definition: to see the error of one's ways/to make a clean break with one's past

sentences.english: This technique revolves around the theory of cognitive dissonance.
sentences.chinese: 這個技巧與認知悔悟有關。

sentences.english: Before this ancient image penitent emperors now prostrate themselves in awe.
sentences.chinese: 悔悟的皇帝如今敬畏地拜倒在這尊古聖像面前。

sentences.english: On his deathbed, the priest repented of his crime.
sentences.chinese: 病榻上，神父終於悔悟了。

sentences.english: Confession is one mark of repentance.
sentences.chinese: 坦白是悔悟的一個標誌。

sentences.english: To reGREt one’s errors to the point of not repeating them is true repentance.
sentences.chinese: 反思自己的過錯以至於不重蹈覆轍纔是真正的悔悟。

sentences.english: When they convict, the possible that person has not at his side.
sentences.chinese: 當他們悔悟過來，可能那個人已經不在他的身邊了。

sentences.english: He has done wrong but repented.
Christ is inviting sinners to repentance.
sentences.chinese: 基督正在敦請有罪的人悔悟。

definition: to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to see the error of one's ways/to make a clean break with one's past
lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
